info.title: Oasis Nexus API V1
info.description:
An API for accessing indexed data from the Oasis Network.

<!-- Acts as a separator after search in sidebar -->
# Endpoints

x-query-params.name: offset
x-query-params.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

x-query-params.name: limit
x-query-params.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

x-query-params.name: height
x-query-params.description:
The block height from which to query state. Oasis Nexus does not
make any guarantees about availability of historical state data.

x-query-params.name: window_size_seconds
x-query-params.description:
The size of windows into which the statistic is grouped, in seconds.
The backend supports a limited number of window sizes: 300 (5 minutes) and
86400 (1 day). Requests with other values may be rejected.

x-query-params.name: window_step_seconds
x-query-params.description:
The size of the step between returned statistic windows, in seconds.
The backend supports a limited number of step sizes: 300 (5 minutes) and
86400 (1 day). Requests with other values may be rejected.

get.summary: Returns the status of indexing.

200.description: A JSON object containing status metadata.

get.summary: Returns a list of consensus blocks, sorted from most to least recent.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: A filter on minimum block height, inclusive.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: A filter on maximum block height, inclusive.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A filter on minimum block time, inclusive.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: A filter on maximum block time, exclusive.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: A filter on the block hash.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of consensus blocks.

get.summary: Returns a consensus block.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The block height of the block to return.

200.description: A JSON object containing a consensus block.

get.summary: Returns a list of consensus transactions.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: block
parameters.description: A filter on block height.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: A filter on transaction method.

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: A filter on transaction sender.

parameters.name: rel
parameters.description: A filter on related accounts.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A filter on minimum transaction time, inclusive.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: A filter on maximum transaction time, exclusive.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of consensus transactions.

get.summary: Returns a consensus transaction.

parameters.name: tx_hash
parameters.description: The transaction hash of the transaction to return.

200.description: A JSON object containing a consensus transaction.

get.summary: Returns a list of consensus events.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: block
parameters.description: A filter on block height.

parameters.name: tx_index
parameters.description:
A filter on transaction index. The returned events all need to originate
from a transaction that appeared in `tx_index`-th position in the block.
It is invalid to specify this filter without also specifying a `block`.
Specifying `tx_index` and `block` is an alternative to specifying `tx_hash`;
either works to fetch events from a specific transaction.

parameters.name: tx_hash
rel
parameters.description:
A filter on related accounts. Every returned event will refer to
this account. For example, for a `Transfer` event, this will be the
the sender or the recipient of tokens.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A filter on the event type.

200.description: Consensus events matching the filters, sorted by most recent first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of roothash messages.

get.summary: Returns a list of entities registered at the consensus layer.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

200.description:
A JSON object containing a list of entities registered
at the consensus layer.

get.summary: Returns an entity registered at the consensus layer.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the entity to return.

200.description:
A JSON object containing an entity registered
at the consensus layer.

get.summary: Returns a list of nodes registered at the consensus layer.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the controlling entity of the nodes to return.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of nodes registered at the consensus layer.

get.summary: Returns a node registered at the consensus layer.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The entity ID of the entity controlling the node to return.

parameters.name: node_id
parameters.description: The node ID of the node to return.

200.description: A JSON object containing a node registered at the consensus layer.

get.summary: Returns a list of validators registered at the consensus layer (the list includes all registered entities, even those without a currently active validator node).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
A filter on the validator name. Every returned validator will have
a name that is a superstring of the input param.

200.description:
A JSON object containing a list of validators registered
at the consensus layer.

get.summary: Returns a validator registered at the consensus layer.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the entity to return.

200.description:
A JSON object containing a validator registered at the
consensus layer.

get.summary: Returns historical information for a single validator.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: A filter on minimum epoch number, inclusive.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: A filter on maximum epoch number, inclusive.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the entity to return.

200.description:
A JSON object containing historical information for a 
validator, grouped by epoch in reverse chronological order.

get.summary:
Returns a list of consensus layer accounts.
Note that for performance reasons, the info returned by this endpoint
may be slightly stale (<2 minutes). For the most up-to-date account state,
query the single-account endpoint.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of consensus layer accounts.

get.summary: Returns a consensus layer account.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the account to return.

200.description: A JSON object containing a consensus layer account.

get.summary: Returns an account's delegations.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the account that delegated.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of delegations.

get.summary: Returns a list of delegations to an account.

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the account that is being delegated to.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of delegations.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the account that delegated.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of debonding delegations.

get.summary: Returns a list of debonding delegations to an account.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the that is being delegated to.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of debonding delegations.

get.summary: Returns a list of consensus epochs.

parameters.name: limit

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of consensus epochs.

parameters.name: state

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of governance proposals.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset

parameters.name: proposal_id

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of votes for a governance proposal.

get.summary: Returns a list of Runtime blocks.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: A filter on minimum block height, inclusive.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: A filter on maximum block height, inclusive.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A filter on minimum block time, inclusive.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: A filter on maximum block time, exclusive.

parameters.name: hash
parameters.description: A filter on the block hash.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of Runtime blocks.

get.summary: Returns a list of Runtime transactions.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: block
parameters.description: A filter on block round.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A filter on minimum transaction time, inclusive.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: A filter on maximum transaction time, exclusive.

parameters.name: rel
parameters.description:
A filter on related accounts. Every returned transaction will refer to
this account in a way. For example, for an `accounts.Transfer` tx, this will be
the sender or the recipient of tokens.
Nexus detects related accounts inside EVM transactions and events on a
best-effort basis. For example, it inspects ERC20 methods inside `evm.Call` txs.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of Runtime transactions.

get.summary: Returns runtime transactions with the given transaction hash.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: tx_hash
parameters.description:
The transaction hash of the transaction(s) to return. This can be an
Ethereum transaction hash; the query will compare against both a
transaction's regular tx_hash and eth_tx_hash (if it exists).
This endpoint can return multiple transactions in extremely rare cases,
e.g. when a hash matches multiple Oasis runtime transactions or both
an Oasis runtime transaction and the eth_tx_hash of an evm-transaction.

200.description: The requested runtime transactions.

get.summary: Returns a list of runtime events.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: block
parameters.description: A filter on block round.

parameters.name: tx_index
parameters.description:
A filter on transaction index. The returned events all need to originate
from a transaction that appeared in `tx_index`-th position in the block.
It is invalid to specify this filter without also specifying a `block`.
Specifying `tx_index` and `round` is an alternative to specifying `tx_hash`;
either works to fetch events from a specific transaction.

parameters.name: tx_hash
parameters.description:
A filter on the hash of the transaction that originated the events.
Specifying `tx_index` and `round` is an alternative to specifying `tx_hash`;
either works to fetch events from a specific transaction.
This can be an Ethereum transaction hash; the query will compare against
both a transaction's regular tx_hash and eth_tx_hash (if it exists).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A filter on the event type.

parameters.name: rel
parameters.description:
A filter on related accounts. Every returned event will refer to
this account. For example, for a `accounts.Transfer` event, this will be
the sender or the recipient of tokens.

parameters.name: evm_log_signature
parameters.description:
A filter on the evm log signatures.
Note: The filter will only match on parsed (verified) EVM events.

parameters.name: contract_address
parameters.description:
A filter on a smart contract. Every returned event will have been
emitted by the contract at this address.

parameters.name: nft_id
parameters.description:
A filter on NFT events. Every returned event will be specifically
about this NFT instance ID. You must specify the contract_address
filter with this filter.
Currently this only supports ERC-721 Transfer events.
This may expand to support other event types in the future.
If you want only ERC-721 Transfer events, specify
evm_log_signature=ddf252ad1be2c89b69c2b068fc378daa952ba7f163c4a11628f55a4df523b3ef
to avoid inadvertently getting other event types if they are
supported later.
Using an evm_log_signature filter with this set to any other value
will match no events.

200.description: Runtime events matching the filters, sorted by most recent first.

get.summary: Returns a list of EVM (ERC-20, ...) tokens on the runtime.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A filter on the name, the name or symbol must contain this value as a substring.

200.description: The requested tokens.

get.summary: Returns info on an EVM (ERC-20, ...) token on the runtime.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the token contract.

200.description: The requested token.

get.summary:
Returns the list of holders of an EVM (ERC-20, ...) token.
This endpoint does not verify that `address` is actually an EVM token; if it is not, it will simply return an empty list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the token contract for which to return the holders.

200.description: The requested holders.

get.summary:
Returns the list of non-fungible token (NFT) instances of an EVM (ERC-721, ...) token.
This endpoint does not verify that `address` is actually an EVM token; if it is not, it will simply return an empty list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the token contract for which to return the NFT instances.

200.description: The requested instances.

get.summary: Returns the non-fungible token (NFT) instance of an EVM (ERC-721, ...) token.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the token contract of the NFT instance.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the NFT instance.

200.description: The requested instances.

get.summary: Returns a runtime account.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the account to return.

200.description: A JSON object containing a runtime layer account.

get.summary: Returns the list of non-fungible token (NFT) instances owned by an account.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The staking address of the owner of the NFT instances.

parameters.name: token_address
parameters.description: Only return NFT instances from the token contract at the given staking address.

200.description: The requested instances.

get.summary: Returns the runtime status.

parameters.name: runtime
parameters.description: The runtime which to query.

200.description: A JSON object containing latest runtime status.

get.summary:
Returns a timeline of the transaction volume at the chosen granularity,
for either consensus or one of the paratimes.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: window_size_seconds
parameters.description:
The size of windows into which the statistic is grouped, in seconds.
The backend supports a limited number of window sizes: 300 (5 minutes) and
86400 (1 day). Requests with other values may be rejected.

parameters.name: window_step_seconds
parameters.description:
The size of the step between returned statistic windows, in seconds.
The backend supports a limited number of step sizes: 300 (5 minutes) and
86400 (1 day). Requests with other values may be rejected.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: The layer for which to return the transaction volume timeline.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of TPS values for each interval.

get.summary:
Returns a (sliding) timeline of the recorded daily unique active accounts for
either consensus or one of the paratimes.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum numbers of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: window_step_seconds
parameters.description:
The size of the step between returned statistic windows, in seconds.
The backend supports a limited number of step sizes: 300 (5 minutes) and
86400 (1 day). Requests with other values may be rejected.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: The layer for which to return the active accounts timeline.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of unique active accounts values for each interval.

total_count.description:
The total number of records that match the query, i.e. the number of records
the query would return with limit=infinity.

is_total_count_clipped.description: Whether total_count is clipped for performance reasons.

latest_block.description:
The height of the most recent indexed block. Compare with latest_node_block to measure
how far behind Nexus is from the chain.

latest_node_block.description: The height of the most recently produced block on-chain as seen by Nexus.

latest_block_time.description: The RFC 3339 formatted consensus time of when the most recently indexed block was produced.

latest_update_age_ms.description: The number of milliseconds since Nexus processed the latest block.

num_transactions.description: Number of transactions in the block.

gas_limit.description:
The gas limit for the block. A gas limit 0 means that the max block gas was unlimited.
Blocks from Cobalt, Damask, and early Eden had no gas limit as their sizes were only
restricted by byte size until an upgrade during Eden introduced a gas limit.

size_limit.description: The size limit for the block in bytes.

epoch.description: The epoch number of the epoch in which the block was produced.

state_root.description: The Merkle root of the state tree after applying the block.

amount.description: The amount of tokens delegated in base units.
The amount of tokens delegated in base units.

debond_end.description: The epoch at which the debonding ends.

block.description: The block height at which this transaction was executed.

index.description: 0-based index of this transaction in its block

timestamp.description:
The second-granular consensus time of this tx's block, i.e. roughly when the
[block was proposed](https://github.com/tendermint/tendermint/blob/v0.34.x/spec/core/data_structures.md#header).

hash.description: The cryptographic hash of this transaction's encoding.

sender.description: The address of who sent this transaction.

nonce.description: The nonce used with this transaction, to prevent replay.

fee.description:
The fee that this transaction's sender committed
to pay to execute it.

gas_limit.description: The maximum gas that a transaction can use.

body.description: The method call body. This spec does not encode the many possible types; instead, see [the Go API](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go) of oasis-core. This object will conform to one of the types passed to variable instantiations using `NewMethodName` two levels down the hierarchy, e.g. `MethodTransfer` from `oasis-core/go/staking/api` seen [here](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go@v0.2300.10/staking/api#pkg-variables).

error.description: Error details of a failed transaction.

module.description: The module of a failed transaction.

code.description: The status code of a failed transaction.

message.description:
The message of a failed transaction.
This field, like `code` and `module`, can represent an error that originated
anywhere in the paratime, i.e. either inside or outside a smart contract.

A common special case worth calling out: When the paratime is
EVM-compatible (e.g. Emerald or Sapphire) and the error originates
inside a smart contract (using `revert` in solidity), the following
will be true:
- `module` will be "evm" and `code` will be 8; see [here](https://github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-sdk/blob/runtime-sdk/v0.8.3/runtime-sdk/modules/evm/src/lib.rs#L128) for other possible errors in the `evm` module.
- `message` will contain the best-effort human-readable revert reason.

revert_params.description:
The error parameters, as decoded using the contract abi. Present only when
- the error originated from within a smart contract (e.g. via `revert` in Solidity), and
- the contract is verified or the revert reason is a plain String.
If this field is present, `message` will include the name of the error, e.g. 'InsufficentBalance'.
Note that users should be cautious when evaluating error data since the
data origin is not tracked and error information can be faked.

block.description: The block height at which this event was generated.

tx_index.description:
0-based index of this event's originating transaction within its block.
Absent if the event did not originate from a transaction.

tx_hash.description:
Hash of this event's originating transaction.
Absent if the event did not originate from a transaction.

roothash_runtime_id.description:
The ID of the runtime to which the event relates, encoded in hex.
Present only for events of type `roothash.*`.

roothash_runtime.description:
The runtime to which the event relates.
Present only for events of type `roothash.*`.

roothash_runtime_round.description:
When applicable, the round in the runtime to which this event
relates.
Present only for events of type `roothash.*` except for
`roothash.execution_discrepancy` before Eden.

body.description:
The event contents. This spec does not encode the many possible types;
instead, see [the Go API](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go/consensus/api/transaction/results#Event) of oasis-core.
This object will conform to one of the `*Event` types two levels down
the hierarchy, e.g. `TransferEvent` from `Event > staking.Event > TransferEvent`

ConsensusEvent.description: An event emitted by the consensus layer.

runtime.description: The runtime that sent this message.

round.description: The block round when the runtime sent this message.

index.description: The 0-based index of this message in the block.

body.description:
The "body" of a message is a structure within the
`github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go/roothash/api/message`
`Message` structure
(https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go/roothash/api/message#Message).
For example, if the type is `staking.withdraw`, the body is the Go
`Message` structure's `.Staking.Withdraw` field, which is a
`github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go/staking/api` `Withdraw`
structure
(https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go/staking/api#Withdraw),
with `from` and `amount` fields in JSON.

error_module.description:
If executing this message resulted in an error, this is the
error's module.

error_code.description:
If executing this message resulted in an error, this is the
error's code.

result.description:
A result value that consensus provided after executing this
message. These aren't centrally registered anywhere, so look at
the consensus apps' `ExecuteMessage`
(https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go/consensus/cometbft/api#MessageSubscriber)
implementations to see what they return. For example, a
`staking.withdraw` type message gives a
`github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go/staking/api`
`WithdrawResult` structure as its result
(`https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go/staking/api#WithdrawResult`)
with `owner`, `beneficiary`, `allowance`, and `amount_change`
fields.

allOf.description: A list of entities registered at the consensus layer.

id.description: The public key identifying this entity.

address.description: The staking address belonging to this entity; derived from the entity's public key.

nodes.description: The vector of nodes owned by this entity.

Entity.description: An entity registered at the consensus layer.

stats.description: Summary statistics across all consensus validators.
Summary statistics across all consensus validators.

allOf.description:
A list of validators registered at the consensus layer, plus summary
statistics across all consensus validators.

total_voting_power.description: The total voting power across all validators.

total_delegators.description: The total number of delegators in the network.

total_staked_balance.description: The total amount of token staked to validators.

url.description: An URL associated with the entity.

email.description: An email address associated with the entity.

name.description: The human-readable name of this entity.

logoUrl.description: URL to a logo image for the entity.

entity_address.description: The staking address identifying this validator.

entity_id.description: The public key identifying this validator.

node_id.description: The public key identifying this validator's node.

escrow.description: The escrow account data for this validator.

voting_power.description: The voting power of this validator.

voting_power_cumulative.description: The cumulative voting power of this validator and all other validators ranked higher than itself.

active.description: Whether the entity has a node that is registered for being a validator, node is up to date, and has successfully registered itself. It may or may not be part of validator set.

rank.description: The rank of the validator, determined by voting power.

in_validator_set.description: Whether the entity is part of the validator set (top <scheduler.params.max_validators> by stake among active entities).

Validator.description: An validator registered at the consensus layer.

active_balance.description: The amount of tokens that are delegated to this validator account, and are NOT in the process of debonding.

active_shares.description: The shares of tokens that are delegated to this validator account, and are NOT in the process of debonding.

debonding_balance.description: The amount of tokens that are delegated to this validator account, but are also in the process of debonding (i.e. they will be unstaked within ~2 weeks).

debonding_shares.description: The shares of tokens that are delegated to this validator account, but are also in the process of debonding (i.e. they will be unstaked within ~2 weeks).

self_delegation_balance.description: The amount of token this validator has delegated to itself, and are NOT in the process of debonding.

self_delegation_shares.description: The shares of tokens this validator has delegated to itself, and are NOT in the process of debonding.

active_balance_24.description: The active_balance of this validator account 24 hours ago.

num_delegators.description: The number of accounts that have delegated token to this account.

address.description: The staking address of the validator.

allOf.description: Historical escrow balance data for a single address.

active_balance.description:
The amount of tokens that were delegated to this validator account, 
at the start of this epoch, and are NOT in the process of debonding.

active_shares.description:
The shares of tokens that were delegated to this validator account, 
at the start of this epoch, and are NOT in the process of debonding.

debonding_balance.description:
The amount of tokens that were delegated to this validator account
at the start of this epoch, but are also in the process of debonding 
(i.e. they will be unstaked within ~2 weeks).

debonding_shares.description:
The shares of tokens that were delegated to this validator account
at the start of this epoch, but are also in the process of debonding 
(i.e. they will be unstaked within ~2 weeks).

num_delegators.description: The number of accounts that have delegated token to this account.

allOf.description: A list of nodes registered at the consensus layer.

id.description: The public key identifying this node.

entity_id.description: The public key identifying the entity controlling this node.

expiration.description: The epoch in which this node's commitment expires.

tls_pubkey.description: The public key used for establishing TLS connections.

tls_next_pubkey.description:
The public key that will be used for establishing TLS connections
upon rotation.

p2p_pubkey.description: The unique identifier of this node on the P2P transport.

consensus_pubkey.description: The unique identifier of this node as a consensus member

roles.description: A bitmask representing this node's roles.

Node.description: A node registered at the consensus layer.

allOf.description: A list of consensus layer accounts.

AddressPreimage.description:
The data from which a consensus-style address (`oasis1...`)
was derived. Notably, for EVM runtimes like Sapphire,
this links the Oasis address and the Ethereum address.

Oasis addresses are derived from a piece of data, such as an ed25519
public key or an Ethereum address. For example, [this](https://github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-sdk/blob/b37e6da699df331f5a2ac62793f8be099c68469c/client-sdk/go/helpers/address.go#L90-L91)
is how an Ethereum is converted to an Oasis address. The type of underlying data usually also
determines how the signatuers for this address are verified.

Consensus supports only "staking addresses" (`context="oasis-core/address: staking"`
below; always ed25519-backed).
Runtimes support all types. This means that every consensus address is also
valid in every runtime. For example, in EVM runtimes, you can use staking
addresses, but only with Oasis tools (e.g. a wallet); EVM contracts such as
ERC20 tokens or tools such as Metamask cannot interact with staking addresses.

context.description: The method by which the Oasis address was derived from `address_data`.

address_data.description:
The base64-encoded data from which the Oasis address was derived.
When `context = "oasis-runtime-sdk/address: secp256k1eth"`, this
is the Ethereum address (in base64, not hex!).

RuntimeSdkBalance.description: Balance of an account for a specific runtime and oasis-sdk token (e.g. ROSE).

balance.description: Number of tokens held, in base units.

token_symbol.description: The token ticker symbol. Unique across all oasis-sdk tokens in the same runtime.

token_decimals.description: The number of decimals of precision for this token.

RuntimeEvmBalance.description: Balance of an account for a specific runtime and EVM token.

balance.description: Number of tokens held, in base units.

token_contract_addr.description: The Oasis address of this token's contract.

token_contract_addr_eth.description: The EVM address of this token's contract.

token_symbol.description: The token ticker symbol. Not guaranteed to be unique across distinct EVM tokens.

token_name.description: The name of the token. Not guaranteed to be unique across distinct EVM tokens.

token_decimals.description: The number of decimals of precision for this token.

allOf.description: A list of token holders for a specific (implied) runtime and token.

BareTokenHolder.description: Balance of an account for a specific (implied) runtime and token.

holder_address.description: The Oasis address of the account holder.

eth_holder_address.description: The Ethereum address of the same account holder, if meaningfully defined.

balance.description: Number of tokens held, in base units.

address.description: The staking address for this account.

nonce.description: The expected nonce for the next transaction (= last used nonce + 1)

available.description: The available balance, in base units.

escrow.description: The active escrow balance, in base units.

debonding.description: The debonding escrow balance, in base units.

delegations_balance.description: The balance of this accounts' (outgoing) delegations, in base units.

debonding_delegations_balance.description: The balance of this accounts' (outgoing) debonding delegations, in base units.

first_activity.description:
The second-granular consensus time of the block in which this account was first active.
Dates before Cobalt (2021-04-28) are approximate.

allowances.description:
The allowances made by this account.
This field is omitted when listing multiple accounts.

amount.description:
The amount allowed for the allowed account.
This field is omitted when listing multiple accounts.

start_height.description: The (inclusive) height at which this epoch started.

end_height.description: The (inclusive) height at which this epoch ended. Omitted if the epoch is still active.

ProposalTarget.description: The target propotocol versions for this upgrade proposal.

id.description: The unique identifier of the proposal.

submitter.description: The staking address of the proposal submitter.

deposit.description: The deposit attached to this proposal.

handler.description: The name of the upgrade handler.

epoch.description: The epoch at which the proposed upgrade will happen.

cancels.description:
The proposal to cancel, if this proposal proposes
cancelling an existing proposal.

parameters_change_module.description:
The name of the module whose parameters are to be changed
by this 'parameters_change' proposal.

parameters_change.description: The parameters change proposal body. This spec does not encode the many possible types; instead, see [the Go API](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-core/go) of oasis-core. This object will conform to one of the `ConsensusParameterChanges` types, depending on the `parameters_change_module`.

created_at.description: The epoch at which this proposal was created.

closes_at.description: The epoch at which voting for this proposal will close.

invalid_votes.description: The number of invalid votes for this proposal, after tallying.

proposal_id.description: The unique identifier of the proposal.

votes.description: The list of votes for the proposal.

allOf.description: A list of votes for a governance proposal.

address.description: The staking address casting this vote.

height.description: The block height at which this vote was recorded.

timestamp.description: The second-granular consensus time of the block in which this vote was cast.

num_transactions.description: The number of transactions in the block.

size.description: The total byte size of all transactions in the block.

gas_used.description: The total gas used by all transactions in the block.

round.description: The block height at which this event was generated.

tx_index.description:
0-based index of this event's originating transaction within its block.
Absent if the event did not originate from a transaction.

tx_hash.description:
Hash of this event's originating transaction.
Absent if the event did not originate from a transaction.

eth_tx_hash.description:
Ethereum trasnsaction hash of this event's originating transaction.
Absent if the event did not originate from an EVM transaction.

timestamp.description: The second-granular consensus time of this event's block.

body.description:
The decoded event contents, possibly augmented with additional address info.
This spec does not encode the many possible types; instead, see [the Go API](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-sdk/client-sdk/go/modules).
This object will conform to one of the `*Event` types two levels down
the hierarchy (e.g. `MintEvent` from `accounts > Event > MintEvent`),
OR `evm > Event`. For object fields that specify an oasis-style address, Nexus
will add a field specifying the corresponding Ethereum address, if known. Currently,
the only such possible fields are `from_eth`, `to_eth`, and `owner_eth`.

evm_log_name.description:
If the event type is `evm.log`, this field describes the human-readable type of
evm event, e.g. `Transfer`.
Absent if the event type is not `evm.log`.

evm_log_params.description:
The decoded `evm.log` event data.
Absent if the event type is not `evm.log`.

RuntimeEvent.description: An event emitted by the runtime layer

evm_type.description: The solidity type of the parameter.

EvmAbiParam.description:
A decoded parameter of an event or error emitted from an EVM runtime.
Values of EVM type `int128`, `uint128`, `int256`, `uint256`, `fixed`, and `ufixed` are represented as strings.
Values of EVM type `address` and `address payable` are represented as lowercase hex strings with a "0x" prefix.
Values of EVM type `bytes` and `bytes<N>` are represented as base64 strings.
Values of other EVM types (integer types, strings, arrays, etc.) are represented as their JSON counterpart.

symbol.description: Symbol of the token, as provided by token contract's `symbol()` method.

decimals.description:
The number of least significant digits in base units that should be displayed as
decimals when displaying tokens. `tokens = base_units / (10**decimals)`.
Affects display only. Often equals 18, to match ETH.

EvmEventToken.description: Details about the EVM token involved in the event, if any.

creation_tx.description:
The Oasis cryptographic hash of the transaction that created the smart contract.
Can be omitted for contracts that were created by another contract, as opposed
to a direct `Create` call.

eth_creation_tx.description:
The Ethereum transaction hash of the transaction in `creation_tx`.
Encoded as a lowercase hex string.

creation_bytecode.description:
The creation bytecode of the smart contract. This includes the constructor logic
and the constructor parameters. When run, this code generates the runtime bytecode.
Can be omitted for contracts that were created by another contract, as opposed
to a direct `Create` call.

runtime_bytecode.description:
The runtime bytecode of the smart contract. This is the code stored on-chain that
describes a smart contract. Every contract has this info, but Nexus fetches
it separately, so the field may be missing for very fresh contracts (or if the fetching
process is stalled).

gas_used.description: The total amount of gas used to create or call this contract.

verification.description:
Additional information obtained from contract verification. Only available for smart
contracts that have been verified successfully by Sourcify.

VerificationLevel.description:
The level of verification of a smart contract, as defined by Sourcify.
An absence of this field means that the contract has not been verified.
See also https://docs.sourcify.dev/docs/full-vs-partial-match/

compilation_metadata.description:
The smart contract's [metadata.json](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/metadata.html) file in JSON format as defined by Solidity.
Includes the smart contract's [ABI](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/develop/abi-spec.html).

source_files.description: Array of all contract source files, in JSON format as returned by [Sourcify](https://sourcify.dev/server/api-docs/#/Repository/get_files_any__chain___address_).

round.description: The block round at which this transaction was executed.

index.description: The 0-based index of this transaction in the block.

timestamp.description: The second-granular consensus time when this tx's block was proposed.

hash.description: The Oasis cryptographic hash of this transaction's encoding.

eth_hash.description:
The Ethereum cryptographic hash of this transaction's encoding.
Absent for non-Ethereum-format transactions.

sender_0.description:
The Oasis address of this transaction's 0th signer.
Unlike Ethereum, Oasis natively supports multiple-signature transactions.
However, the great majority of transactions only have a single signer in practice.
Retrieving the other signers is currently not supported by this API.

sender_0_eth.description: The Ethereum address of this transaction's 0th signer.

nonce_0.description: The nonce used with this transaction's 0th signer, to prevent replay.

fee.description:
The fee that this transaction's sender committed to pay to execute
it (total ParaTime base units, as a string).

fee_proxy_module.description: The module of the fee proxy.

fee_proxy_id.description: the base64-encoded id of the fee proxy.

gas_limit.description:
The maximum gas that this transaction's sender committed to use to
execute it.

gas_used.description: The total gas used by the transaction.

charged_fee.description:
The fee that was charged for the transaction execution (total, native denomination,
ParaTime base units, as a string).
For EVM transactions this is calculated as `gas_price * gas_used`, where `gas_price = fee / gas_limit`, for compatibility with Ethereum.
For other transactions this equals to `fee`.

size.description: The total byte size of the transaction.

method.description:
The method that was called. Defined by the runtime. In theory, this could be any string as the runtimes evolve.
In practice, Nexus currently expects only the following methods:
  - "accounts.Transfer"
  - "consensus.Deposit"
  - "consensus.Withdraw"
  - "consensus.Delegate"
  - "consensus.Undelegate"
  - "evm.Create"
  - "evm.Call"
May be null if the transaction was malformed or encrypted.

body.description: The method call body. May be null if the transaction was malformed.

is_likely_native_token_transfer.description:
Whether this transaction likely represents a native token transfer.
This is based on a heuristic, and can change at any time without warning and possibly without updating the documentation.
The current heuristic sets this to `true` for:
 - Transactions with method "accounts.Transfer". Those are always native token transfers.
 - Transactions with method "evm.Call" that have no `data` field in their `body`. Those tend to be transfers, but the runtimes provides no reliable visibility into whether a transfer happened.
Note: Other transactions with method "evm.Call", and possibly "evm.Create", may also be (or include) native token transfers. The heuristic will be `false` for those.

to.description:
A reasonable "to" Oasis address associated with this transaction,
if applicable. The meaning varies based on the transaction method. Some notable examples:
  - For `method = "accounts.Transfer"`, this is the paratime account receiving the funds.
  - For `method = "consensus.Deposit"`, this is the paratime account receiving the funds.
  - For `method = "consensus.Withdraw"`, this is the consensus (!) account receiving the funds.
  - For `method = "consensus.Delegate"`, this is the consensus (!) account receiving the funds.
  - For `method = "consensus.Undelegate"`, this is the consensus (!) account to which funds were previously delegated. Note that this corresponds with the `.from` field in the transaction body.
  - For `method = "evm.Create"`, this is the address of the newly created smart contract.
  - For `method = "evm.Call"`, this is the address of the called smart contract

to_eth.description: A reasonable "to" Ethereum address associated with this transaction,

amount.description:
A reasonable "amount" associated with this transaction, if
applicable. The meaning varies based on the transaction method.
Usually in native denomination, ParaTime units. As a string.

amount_symbol.description: The denomination of the "amount" associated with this transaction, if applicable.

encryption_envelope.description:
The data relevant to the encrypted transaction. Only present for encrypted
transactions in confidential EVM runtimes like Sapphire.
Note: The term "envelope" in this context refers to the [Oasis-style encryption envelopes](https://github.com/oasisprotocol/oasis-sdk/blob/c36a7ee194abf4ca28fdac0edbefe3843b39bf69/runtime-sdk/src/types/callformat.rs)
which differ slightly from [digital envelopes](hhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hybrid_cryptosystem#Envelope_encryption).

success.description:
Whether this transaction successfully executed.
Can be absent (meaning "unknown") for confidential runtimes.

evm_fn_name.description:
The name of the smart contract function called by the transaction.
Only present for `evm.log` transaction calls to contracts that have been verified.

evm_fn_params.description:
The decoded parameters with which the smart contract function was called.
Only present for `evm.log` transaction calls to contracts that have been verified.

error.description: Error details of a failed transaction.

format.description: The format of the encrypted evm transaction envelope.

public_key.description: The base64-encoded public key used to encrypt the transaction.

data_nonce.description: The base64-encoded nonce used to encrypt the transaction data.

result_nonce.description: The base64-encoded nonce used to encrypt the transaction results.

address.description: The staking address for this account.

balances.description:
The balance(s) of this account in this runtime. Most runtimes use only one denomination, and thus
produce only one balance here. These balances do not include "layer (n+1) tokens", i.e. tokens
managed by smart contracts deployed in this runtime. For example, in EVM-compatible runtimes,
this does not include ERC-20 tokens

evm_contract.description:
Data on the EVM smart contract associated with this account address. Only present for accounts
that represent a smart contract on EVM.

evm_balances.description:
The balances of this account in each runtime, as managed by EVM smart contracts (notably, ERC-20).
NOTE: This field is limited to 1000 entries. If you need more, please let us know in a GitHub issue.

active_nodes.description: The number of compute nodes that are registered and can run the runtime.

latest_block.description: The height of the most recent indexed block (also sometimes referred to as "round") for this runtime. Query a synced Oasis node for the latest block produced.

latest_block_time.description: The RFC 3339 formatted consensus time of when the latest indexed block for this runtime was produced.

latest_update_age_ms.description: The number of milliseconds since Nexus processed the latest block.

EvmTokenType.description: The type of a EVM token.

evm_tokens.description: A list of L2 EVM tokens (ERC-20, ERC-721, ...).

allOf.description: A list of tokens in a runtime.

contract_addr.description: The Oasis address of this token's contract.

eth_contract_addr.description: The Ethereum address of this token's contract.

name.description: Name of the token, as provided by token contract's `name()` method.

symbol.description: Symbol of the token, as provided by token contract's `symbol()` method.

decimals.description:
The number of least significant digits in base units that should be displayed as
decimals when displaying tokens. `tokens = base_units / (10**decimals)`.
Affects display only. Often equals 18, to match ETH.

type.description:
The heuristically determined interface that the token contract implements.
A less specialized variant of the token might be detected; for example, an
ERC-1363 token might be labeled as ERC-20 here. If the type cannot be
detected or is not supported, this field will be null/absent.

total_supply.description: The total number of base units available.

num_transfers.description: The total number of transfers of this token.

num_holders.description: The number of addresses that have a nonzero balance of this token.

is_verified.description:
Whether the contract has been successfully verified by Sourcify.
Additional information on verified contracts is available via
the `/{runtime}/accounts/{address}` endpoint.
DEPRECATED: This field will be removed in the future in favor of verification_level

evm_nfts.description: A list of L2 EVM NFT (ERC-721, ...) instances.

id.description: The instance ID of this NFT within the collection represented by `token`.

owner.description: The Oasis address of this NFT instance's owner.

owner_eth.description: The Ethereum address of this NFT instance's owner.

num_transfers.description: The total number of transfers of this NFT instance.

metadata.description:
A metadata document for this NFT instance.
Currently only ERC-721 is supported, where the document is an Asset Metadata from the ERC721 Metadata JSON Schema.

name.description: Identifies the asset which this NFT represents

description.description: Describes the asset which this NFT represents

image.description:
A URI pointing to a resource with mime type image/* representing
the asset which this NFT represents. (Additional
non-descriptive text from ERC-721 omitted.)

total_sent.description:
The total amount of native tokens sent, in base units.
DEPRECATED: This field might be inaccurate. Nexus is currently not able to track
certain actions which subtract/add tokens.

total_received.description:
The total amount of native tokens received, in base units.
DEPRECATED: This field might be inaccurate. Nexus is currently not able to track
certain actions which subtract/add tokens.

num_txns.description: The total number of transactions this account was involved with.

windows.description: The list of daily transaction volumes.

TxVolumeList.description: A list of daily transaction volumes.

window_end.description: The end timestamp for this daily transaction volume measurement.

tx_volume.description: The transaction volume for this window.

windows.description: The list of daily unique active account windows.

ActiveAccountsList.description: A list of daily unique active account windows.

window_end.description: The date for the end of the daily active accounts measurement window.

active_accounts.description: The number of active accounts for the 24hour window ending at window_end.

NotFoundError.description: An empty response indicating that the requested resource was not found.

EthAddress.description: An Ethereum-compatible address, hex-encoded. Capitalization does not matter.
